text: Hi folks, I’m new here and wondering if there’s a good place to go to get API support? My app usually works fine, but for one customer it’s returning a 401 error and suggesting that no OAuth credentials have been provided. Very odd, because I can see them in the debug view, the Authorization header is right there! Any clues?
e.g, this is the response
but in the request headers…
Hey Guys
I have an objective in mind that seems to be a dearly wanted feature, sorely lacking in HubSpot

I would like to create an "ACCEPT QUOTE" button at the end of quote templates.
*When clicked the button should do the following:*  
1. Mark the quote as ACCEPTED within HubSpot
2. Send an email to the quote owner (salesperson) that the quote has been accepted
No silly e-signature, I just want a simple button that does these things when clicked...
*Anyone have a solution, suggestion or ideas how to solve this? I've asked chatGPT but it only got me halfway - I got errors from using it's suggested code.*
Thanks in advance :slightly_smiling_face: :slightly_smiling_face: :slightly_smiling_face:
This is what it would look like (two buttons in this case because I've been testing a lot)
Hi @team anyone knows how to get HubSB data inside the HubSpot Module using AJAX CALL ?

Hello,
I want to get all tickets data from the api endpoint. (Ref - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/tickets>) with the properties into it.
We can pass the properties into the query params. What's the maximum number of limit for the properties to be passed in single request?
Please let me know asap :pray::pray:
Thanks, that helped!
Is there a way to fetch all records of a Custom Object from the API?

Hello,

I would like to achieve the following via the API:

Requests made through our contact form should be sent to the HubSpot API in PHP and stored in our contacts.

I have a developer account and would like to integrate it in PHP without an SDK.

I assume it works as follows:
1. Call endpoint (according to the documentation)
2. Send data to the endpoint  (according to the documentation)
3. Include authentication in the request
4. Call via Curl
5. 
To my knowledge, authentication looks like this:

"Authorization: Bearer " . APIKEY

Is this correct, and is the API key the developer API key that I can retrieve from the dev account?

Thank you!
René

Hello,

We are wanting to run our own forms on our site, (various reasons as to why) and the use the API to post said form data to the HubSpot form that has been replaced. I can see this in the legacy docs, <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication> but can't find anything similar in new api docs, is this end point being removed or is just how you authenticate api calls that is changing?
Does anyone ever get any answers in this Slack?
of course
I really don't see any way that the api could help you with this
You could use GraphQL to get data from multiple tables at once, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages>
Are you asking if there is a way to not show that contact token dropdown?
yes
You'll want to remove the array so instead it would look like this: `"Authorization":"Bearer CJmv1cxxxxxx"`

You could setup a serverless function on HubSpot, and then when the button is pressed send the quote id to the serverless function, and have the serverless function update the deal and move it to closed won
Then you could have a workflow that whenever a deal is moved to closedwon send the email to the owner
There shouldn't be any limits for the number of properties
You could use this endpoint:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
You will need to use the after parameter to get the next page of objects, (100 records per page, set the limit to 100)
Yes you have all of that right, except you're going to want to use a private app instead of an apikay
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

That api is up to date, although if you're trying to send the data from the frontend of your website you're going to want to use the unauthenicated version instead so you don't have to show your private app token where everyone can see it
Hey <@U04QYDFGYE5>, please post this in the <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel. Thanks!
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
Do you have a specific question?
Yeah currently that isn't an option, I'm interested though what is the usecase?

Hey Kim, this is a community Slack where fellow developer community members (like <@U01QVR44MEY>!) do their best to support each other. You may not always get an immediate answer due to the ephemeral nature of slack, and things like time zones (most of our members are based in North America). We’d love if you could take a look at some questions and see if you can help some of your fellow community members - our hope is that what goes around comes around. Thanks!

```Hello everyone, everything good?

As HubSpot login changes changed to Private App, some endpoints were broken, like this one: <https://api.hubapi.com/account-info/v3/details?hapikey>.

I would like to look at which endpoint I can be using to monitor my applications. In particular, to handle how many percent of requests I'm consuming from the HubSpot APP.

Could anyone help me about this?
Att.```

Hi team. I hope everyone is well. I want to do integration with private app. I need to check the access_token and scopes of the private app while making the integration connection.

Is there an API where I can check the access token and get the scopes for the private app? I couldn’t find. Could you please help me?
It will be sent from our server once we have dealt with file uploads etc.
Many thanks for confirming the api is not being deprecated!
You can hit that endpoint with a Bearer token (auth’ed through a private app), instead of the deprecated API key.
<@UCBDLK6SU> the problem though is that that particular endpoint doesn't support oauth
The best work around for the time being is to use the headers that get returned in any of the requests you make
Here's another thread where I walk through the process
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1669928020215599>
of course
Just so you know event the v1 endpoints aren't being deprecated for a while (no timeframe yet) so all the v3 endpoints should keep going for many year to come
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> and <@UCBDLK6SU>!! :rocket::+1:
of course
I get this error - `414 Request-URI Too Large`  whenever I pass huge number of properties. What is the best solution to avoid this kind of error?

hey <@UD53A9UUR> , apologies for the delay but were you able to look into this? We are looking to see what scopes need to be defined for our marketplace app that will work for every user regardless of their HubSpot account plan access.
Well if you define the scopes that aren't accessible to every HubSpot account in the optional_scopes field every user will still be able to install the app
an example is crm.schemas.customobjects.read, and write
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth>
Are you trying to request every property? another option would be to use the search endpoint and define the properties in the body

Hi all - has anyone experienced issues with the custom coded workflow modules on HubSpot Ops Pro for running fetch commands to enrich data from third parties? We are looking at using the HubSpot ops hub to enrich data but I am just a little concerned on their capability.

Hello all, this is my first experience with HubSpot, i have created a private app to access the APIs. i want to use audit-log api. and according to documentation i have assigned "content" type scope to app, and when running the API call its gives 403 error, like scope is missing.
`curl --location --request GET '<https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/audit-logs/>' \`
`--header 'authorization: Bearer [SECRET]'`

scope assigned.

no worries about the token i will regenerate it after resolving the issue  :grin:

Hello all, we use a v1 endpoint `/contacts/v1/contact/createOrUpdate/email/` to upsert contacts into our instance. As of Feb 7th, we noticed a change in behavior for fields set to null in the JSON payload. It seems that the API now blanks out the contact properties if the property value is null. It used to ignore those fields. Can someone confirm this change?
I want to fetch the tickets data (with default and custom properties) using api endpoint. How can I do it?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCQ7H31D5/p1677087684671549>

What I did is create a note with properties.hs_attachment_ids = 1234, where 1234 is the id of the file, then associate that note to the company, I don’t know if this is the only way but it worked for me.

Hi all, is there any way to request Campaigns through the API? Marketing Campaigns, not email campaigns. I have a client that just added a custom field to the Campaign and wants us to pull that in. I saw this question from a year ago that looks like it’s what I need, is there any update to this? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Get-campaign-data-by-api/m-p/562864>

Thanks!
They are super capable
Built right on top of lambdas so they scale without a problem, never run into any issues with them
just remember the 20 sec limit though...
You could do this with the search api just specify your properties in the request body
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
You can use the properties api to pull in all the properties for tickets
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties#endpoint?spec=GET-/crm/v3/properties/%7BobjectType%7D>
Yeah there is an api for that one moment
Just as an FYI private apps and oauth tokens are very different things
private apps are for one specific account and oauth tokens are generated from marketplace apps
Here's that api:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth/tokens>
I think that’s just the JSON encoding of the headers in the portal
The headers are being sent in the correct format for the actual request :slightly_smiling_face:
do you just want to double check this by sending on request to <http://webhook.site|webhook.site>

Sure, I can output the headers from the client library if that is enough? This same code path works for a bunch of other customers so I can’t see why it would be an incorrect header format - it seems to only happen for this specific token in other words.
yes very interesting, have you tied regenerating the token? I don't think that would be it but thought I might suggest it (you might have already done this)
Yep, have refreshed
Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY> :pray: I know private apps and oauth tokens are different. I developing for one specific account but I need checking to some information.
Sounds good, let me know if you run into any issues
Can token parameter be given as access_token of private app?
Yep you can use a private app token with that api
But when I try in postman I get 400
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Access-token-in-wrong-format/td-p/232947>
sorry bud, I sent you the wrong endpoint on accident:
This is the correct one
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps#view-private-app-access-token-information>
ah thank you so much I missed it
of course, sorry I sent you the wrong one at first
No problem. Thank you for your time :pray:
of course
Yeah that code will definitely not work for what you're trying to do, basically custom coded actions don't have memory and can reset between runs

I talked with your engineer York about this but what I would recommend is to use a database to keep track of the records that run through per day and if the number of records that ran through for the day is under 120 let the record progress through the workflow if not just tag that record with a needs to go through workflow property
and this is for a workflow custom coded action right? just wanted to double check because York said workflow but you said module

Do you know how to do this? I have no idea where to start. Again, I've consulted chatGPT about this and got some code that I tried - but they always showed errors in the Chrome Console when I attempted to click the button.
I have limited programming experience, certainly no expert. I don't know what "serverless" means, or how to do it
<@U01QVR44MEY> The account-info/v3/details endpoint does have private app and oauth.
This is one example I'm using. I get cors error when I try to run it in the browser by clicking the button...
